717216f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, north from Chambers Street, showing an early view of this thoroughfare above the City Hall Park. At the left is the building at the N. W. corner, a holding of the Andrews Estate since 1848. An 18 story structure, designed by Stanford White for the United States Life Insurance Co., will later arise here. Its proximity to the courts will alter these plans to allow a tenancy consisting mainly of attorneys.
1876
Roege, photo
Gift of Urbrock Collection

Neg #831

717215f-a.text:
Broadway west side north from Chnmbers Street,
the latter is on the left.
M.B.R.  1900.
NiCo. WEEo

717214f.text:
Broadway, west side, north from Chambers Street (left). The Hillen Building is to be removed and replaced by the 18-story Broadway Chambers (designed by Stanford White). Note "rill Broa."
and "Childs" occupying adjacent stores.
January 23, 1908
Thru N. Y. Historical Society

717219f.text:
280 Broadway, east side, north from Chamber's (right) to Reade (left, Streets, showing prominently the Sun Building (formerly the Stewart Building. To the right on Chambers Street one has an extensive view eastward to Centre Street, where the huge Municipal Building straddles this thoroughfare. To the left of same is the marble columned Hall of Records.
February 22, 1917
Gift of E. M. Jenks
Neg 742

718952f-a.text:
Broadway, action started in replacing clock in City Hall.

Underwood and Underwood January, 17, 1918.

718961f-b.text:
(1)
City Hall Park: A view across the northwestern corner of the park, and showing buildings on the west side of Broadway at Chambere Street.
May 1924.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same. The prominent building shown, is the 18-story Broadway Chambers (Nos. 273-277 Broadway), and is at the N.W. corner of Chambers
Street.
June 1924.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Another view similar to No. 2.
June 1924.
P. L. Sperr.

717217f-a.text:
279-283 Broadway, west side, between Chambers and Reade Streets, showing Schrafft's Restaurant occupying a newly constructed 3-story building.
Between 1925-30.

718606f-a.text:
Chambers Street, north side, west from Broadway.
April 1, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

718607f-a.text:

to Church Street.

717220f-a.text:
Broadway (left), east side, north from and including Chambers Street and showing prominently No. 280-286 Broadway, the former Stewart Building (now 1937 the Sun Building), ocoupying the Broadway block front from Chambers to Reade Streets. On the right appear a portion of City Hall Park.
About 1930.
Brown Brothers.
Neg.W 26 1:

718615f-a.text:
Chambers Street, north side, from but not including West Broadway
to West Street.
April 19, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

717207f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, south from Chambers (right) to Murray Streets as seen from the Municipal Building and across City Hall Park. In the foreground is the roof of the County Court House,erected by the Tweed Ring. Note the Steamship Berengaria between the New York Telephone Building and No. 270-71 Broadway. The latter stand upon the site of the Shoe and Leather
Bank Building.
June 23, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

717207f-b.text:
Broadway, west side, south from Chambers (right) to Murray Streets as seen from the Municipal Building and across City Hall Park. In the foreground is the roof of the County Court House,erected by the Tweed Ring. Note the Steamship Berengaria between the New York Telephone Building and No. 270-71 Broadway. The latter stand upon the site of the Shoe and Leather
Bank Building.
June 23, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

717212f-a.text:
Broadway, south from Chambers Street, showing on the left a portion of City Hall Park with the old U.S. Post Office at its southern tip.
September 14, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.

718603f-a.text:
(1)
Chambers Street, north side, east from and including Broadway, to and including Centre Street. Building shown (bearing clock) on the N.E. corner of Broadway (No. 280 Broadway), is the Stewart Building and was, prior to about 1889, occupied by the dept. store of that name. Towered building shown arching Chambers at Centre Streets, is the Municipal building.
November 6, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A view of the aforementioned Stewart Building, as seen looking northward on Brcadway and across a portion of City Hall Park.
February 24, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

718603f-b.text:

Towered building shown arching Chambers at Centre Streets, is the Municipal building.
November 6, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)

1509027.title: Broadway - Chambers Street, looking northwest

1509025-a.title: Broadway - Chambers Street, looking south

717213f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, at Chambers Street, showing a clearance at the S.W. corner, across which appears buildings on the north side of Chambers Street. The 5-story structures on the left are Nos. 265-267 Broadway and are midway between Warren and Chambers Streets. The 18-story building on the right, at the N.W. corner of Chambers Street, is the Broadway Chanmbers. This View is photographed in a northwestward direction from
City Hall Park.
February 24, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
